column1: Saint-Eustache is an off-island suburb of Montreal
column4: west of Montreal on the north shore of the Rivière des Mille Îles. It is located 35 km (22 mi) northwest of Montreal.

column1: The city was founded in 1770 and was incorporated in 1835. It has a famous church
A significant battle of the Lower Canada Rebellion was fought here on December 14

column2: General Motors opened a transit bus manufacturing facility in Saint-Eustache. The factory has produced vehicles under the brands of GM
column5: has been owned by Nova Bus.

column1: Saint-Eustache was also home to the Autodrome Saint-Eustache from 1965 to 2019

column2: Quebec Route 344 and Quebec Route 148 are the major highways servicing Saint-Eustache.

column1: The closest airports are Montréal–Pierre Elliott Trudeau International Airport to the south and Montréal–Mirabel International Airport to the north.
The Commission scolaire de la Seigneurie-des-Mille-Îles (CSSMI) operates French-language public schools:

École des Jardins-des-PatriotesSome residents are zoned to École primaire Girouard in Mirabel and École secondaire d'Oka in OkaThe Sir Wilfrid Laurier School Board operates English-language schools. Lake of Two Mountains High School in Deux-Montagnes serves the community. Mountainview Elementary School and Saint Jude Elementary School
